text: Charlotte Robespierre Marie Marguerite Charlotte de Robespierre (5 February 1760, Arras - 1 August 1834, Paris) was a French writer. She was the daughter of François de Robespierre and Jacqueline Marguerite Carrault and the sister of Maximilien de Robespierre and Augustin Robespierre, known for the memoirs she dictated about the life of her brothers during the French Revolution. == References == * Gabriel Pioro et Pierre Labracherie, « Charlotte Robespierre, ihren Memoiren und ihre Freunde », dans Maximilien Robespierre, Berlin, éditions Markov, 1958. == External links == * Category:1760 births Category:1834 deaths Category:People from Arras Category:18th-century French people Category:French memoirists Category:French nobility
